facts_text: 31 is the eighth happy number 31 is the third Mersenne prime (2^5 - 1) The cube root of 31 is the value of pi correct to four significant figures (3.141   31 is the atomic number of galliu   Messier object M31, a magnitude 4.5 galaxy in the constellation Andromeda. It is also known as the Andromeda Galaxy, and is readily visible to the naked eye in a modestly dark sk   31 is the number of days in the months January, March, May, July, August, October and Decembe   31 is Turkish slang for male masturbatio   There are 31 letters in Macedonian alphabe   32 as a Roman numeral: XXX   31 as a binary number: 11111_   Herbert Clark Hoover served as the 31st president of the United States from 1929 to 1933

19 is the eighth prime number The sum of the squares of the first 19 primes is divisible by 19 19 is the sixth Heegner number 19 is the third centered triangular number as well as the third centered hexagonal number 19 is the atomic number of potassium The James Webb Space Telescope's optical elements are in an array of 19 hexagons The 19th Amendment to the United States Constitution gave American women the right to vote The Vietnam War spanned over 19 years, from November 1955 to April 1975 19 written as a Roman numeral is XIX and is 10011 written as a binary number Rutherford Birchard Hayes served as the 19th president of the United States from 1877 to 1881

2 the smallest and only even prime number An integer is called even if it is divisible by 2 2 is the third Fibonacci number 2 is the base of the binary number system The square root of 2 was the first known irrational number 2 is a pronic number 2 is the atomic number of helium The Roman numeral II (usually) stands for the second-discovered satellite of a planet or minor planet (e.g. Pluto II or (87) Sylvia II Remus) John Adams served as the 2nd President of the United States from 1797 to 1801
